data.title: Japan Securities Revenue : $274 Million
data.meta_description: Discover Global Company Information from Japan Securities. Access Japan Securities' Company Profile. Get Revenue & Contact Data
data.text:
Japan Securities refers to financial instruments traded in the Japanese securities market, including stocks, bonds, and derivatives. These securities are regulated by the Financial Services Agency (FSA) and traded on various exchanges like the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) and Osaka Exchange. Japan’s securities market is one of the largest in the world and plays a significant role in the country’s economy.

How to use Business Intelligence from Japan Securities

BoldData can deliver 50+ different data fields from Japan Securities. From company name to address, revenue, contact data, email data, industry, employees, legal form and founding year. Japan Securities Key financial highlights:

Revenue: Japan Securities are influenced by various factors including domestic economic indicators, global market trends, monetary policy decisions by the Bank of Japan, geopolitical events, and investor sentiment. In previous years, it has reported 274 million U.S. dollars in revenue.

Profit: The biggest challenge for Japan Securities to stay profitable is navigating through economic stagnation, deflationary pressures, and an aging population, which can hinder growth prospects and investment opportunities. Japan Securities has historically maintained a considerable net income of 43.2 million U.S. dollars.

Japan Securities’ assets include a wide range of financial instruments such as stocks, bonds, government securities, corporate bonds, real estate investment trusts (REITs), and various derivatives traded on the Japanese securities market. Japan Securities has reported 116.82 billion U.S. dollars in assets.

Japan Securities’ market value is determined by factors such as supply and demand dynamics, company fundamentals, economic conditions, investor sentiment, and global market trends, which collectively influence the prices of individual securities within the Japanese securities market. Japan Securities’ current market value is 655 million U.S. dollars.

Financial data from Japan Securities or other companies is available in Excel, Bulk Dataset or API and can be tailored to your needs by our data experts. Ask a quote via the contact form and buy your custom-made list today!

Number of companies owned by Japan Securities

Japan Securities has 154 subsidiaries in 9 countries. The majority of companies that are owned by Japan Securities are based in Japan (134 companies). Second is China with 9 companies in Japan Securities’ control (6%). Japan Securities also owns 4 companies in Cayman Islands.
